item.title: Ski & Sail 2016
item.description:
Ski & Sail 2016

Join us for a six day long Sail & Ski expedition in Lyngen, Hjørundfjorden or Steigen and Lofoten.

item.title: Arctic Report Card 2015
item.description:
Arctic Report Card 2015

Arctic Report Card: Update for 2015 - Tracking recent environmental changes, with 12 essays prepared by an international team of 72 scientists from 11 different countries and an independent peer-review organized by the Arctic Monitoring and Assessment Programme of the Arctic Council. See http://www.arctic.noaa.gov/reportcard

item.title: Book Review: Sail To Svalbard By Jon Amtrup * Mikael Strandberg
item.description:
Book Review: Sail To Svalbard By Jon Amtrup * Mikael Strandberg

Sail To Svalbard By Jon Armtrup (Skagerak Förlag) Thanks For Giving Me A Glimpse Of Another World Explorer Mikael Strandberg I am getting more interested in sailing by the day. For many reasons. Swedish Polar History involves a fair amount of sailing. Like A.E Nordenskiölds North-East Passage with Vega.

item.title: Explore North's podcast: Are Wiig - Solo jorden rundt
item.description:
Explore North's podcast: Are Wiig - Solo jorden rundt

I 2018 er det 50 år siden Sir Robin Knox-Johnston ble den første til å seile jorden rundt alene. Det skal feires med en jubileumsregatta og Are Wiig skal bli den første nordmannen som gjør akkurat det samme. Hør på første del av en serie med intervjuer med seileren og eventyreren Are Wiig.

item.title: High Latitude Sailing - Jon Amtrup and Bob Shepton
item.description:
High Latitude Sailing - Jon Amtrup and Bob Shepton

Online Catalogue | Books | Practical | Seamanship | High Latitude Sailing - Jon Amtrup and Bob Shepton

item.title: We need fewer exams and more wilderness in education
item.description:
We need fewer exams and more wilderness in education

Government plans to introduce national tests for seven-year-olds shows just how far our exam obsession has come. Our kids now face constant assessment as politicians attempt to measure the success of schools. Children have become tiny cogs in a box-ticking government machine. Education has lost its way.

item.title: Tweed's World
item.description:
Tweed's World

41:36.66S 073:13.15E We spent a couple of days in Metahue observing life, chilling and doing chores. We saw the ferry arrive one evening bringing half a dozen people home from their travels and unloading their shopping which included not only the kitchen sink but a wood fired range and its chimney.
